channel.title: Lua or XML?
channel.description:
I know that these 2 can't be compared to eachother but I just want to learn a new language. I like XML because it has a wide use over many platforms but I also want to learn a scripting language (I know basic Pascal but that doesn't cut it for me).
I like Lua because of how it stores data types (for example you can store integers and strings in the same table) and because of the not-so-large library.
XML isn't really a programing language but I've read alot about it and it looks quite simple and usefull.
I can't learn both at the same time; I'm planning on buying a book for them but I can't find one for Lua in the country I live. I found a book for XML that costs 60 euros though xD I've done alot of research of over 10 programming languages but these 2 are the ones I definately want to learn o.o

item.title: Lua or XML?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

I should warn against using w3schools. It contains loads of outdated and inaccurate information.

http://w3fools.com/

Read full topic

http://www.w3schools.com/xml/default.asp

Learn it in 10 minutes…

item.title: Lua or XML?
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

To be honest, you don’t even really learn XML. It’s basically you setting your own guidelines for the file.

Example:

<employees>
    <employee1>
        <name>
            Douchebag McGee
        </name>
        <address>
            123 FakeAddress.
        </address>
        <moneyPerHour>
             69.00 per hour
        </moneyPerHour>
    </employee1>
</employees>

Read full topic
